intro: Caraguata lepidota, commonly known as the velvet caraguata, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, velvety leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its foliage is covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a unique tactile quality. Caraguata lepidota is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
